info.title: Egress from Dwelling Units
info.subtitle: Volume II - 9.9.9.
info.description: Location and distances of exits from living spaces in a building

1_9_9_9_1.sectionTitle: 9.9.9.1. Travel limit to Exits or Egress Doors

P2.questionText: How many <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have?
P2.questionSubtext: Answer the following questions based on a single <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> within the proposed <defined-term>building</defined-term> to determine it's <defined-term>means of egress</defined-term>.

P3.questionText: Which of the following <defined-term override-term='storey'>storeys</defined-term> within the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have an egress or <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doors on that <defined-term>storey</defined-term>?

P5.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> with greater than 1 <defined-term>storey</defined-term> of travel to an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to a balcony on that floor level?

P6.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> above another <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term>?

P7.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to an openable window with an unobstructed opening of not less than 1m in height and 0.55m in width on this floor level?

P8.questionText: On which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> is the openable window located so that the sill is not more than 1m above the finish floor level and less than 7m above adjacent ground level?

P9.questionText: On which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> is the door an egress door to a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, enclosed <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway, or exterior passageway?

P10.questionText: On which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> is the egress door an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> doorway that is not more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

P11.questionText: Are there more than 2 <defined-term override-term='dwelling unit'>dwelling units</defined-term> in this <defined-term>building</defined-term>?

P12.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have at least two separate <defined-term>means of egress</defined-term>?

P13.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term>’s egress door open onto a <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> or an exterior passageway?

P14.questionText: Where the egress door opens onto the <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> or exterior passageway, is it possible to go in opposite directions to 2 separate <defined-term override-term='exit'>exits</defined-term>?

P15.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a dead-end corridor that is not more than 6m long?

P17.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> meet the definition of a <defined-term>secondary suite</defined-term>?

P18.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have separate and direct access from each <defined-term>storey</defined-term> to a balcony on <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term>: <answer-value answer='P5'></answer-value>?

P19.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have separate and direct access to openable window(s) on level(s): <answer-value answer='P8'></answer-value>?

P20.questionText: Is this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> located above another <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> or common space in a house with a <defined-term>secondary suite</defined-term>?

P21.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto a shared egress facility (<defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, exterior passageway, <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway, or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>) that is served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P21P17.questionText: Does this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> meet the definition of a <defined-term>secondary suite</defined-term>?

P21P5.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> with greater than 1 <defined-term>storey</defined-term> of travel to an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to a balcony on that floor level?

P21P7.questionText: Which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> have access to an openable window with an unobstructed opening of not less than 1m in height and 0.55m in width on this floor level?

P21P8.questionText: On which <defined-term override-term='storey'>storey(s)</defined-term> of the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> is the openable window located so that the sill is not more than 1m above the finish floor level and less than 7m above adjacent ground level?

P22.questionText: Does the egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> open onto an <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway, <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term>, exterior passageway, or balcony, that serves more than one <defined-term>suite</defined-term>?

P23.questionText: The egress door of this <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> opens onto ...

P24.questionText: Is the <defined-term>public corridor</defined-term> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term>?

P25.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P23'></answer-value> served by a single <defined-term>exit</defined-term> stairway or <defined-term>ramp</defined-term>?

P26.questionText: Is the <answer-value answer='P23'></answer-value> not more than 1.5m above adjacent ground level?

P28.questionText: Based on the provided <defined-term>building</defined-term> characteristics, and to meet the provisions of the BC Building Code 2024, is the <defined-term>dwelling unit</defined-term> provided with an exterior passageway that has the design requirements listed below?
P28.questionSubtext:
• has a floor assembly with a fire-resistance rating less than 45 min, and
  • is served by a single exit stairway or ramp, and
  • is located more than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level.

R1_1.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections, the height of this dwelling unit exceeds the maximum height permitted for a building constructed under the BC Building Code 2024 Part 9. Please review your selections for error, if the height of the building exceeds 3 storeys the building will need to be designed in accordance with Parts 3, 4, 5, and 6 of the BC Building Code 2024 and at this time this tool is only designed to assist users to determine conformance with the requirements of the BC Building Code 2024 Part 9. If there are no errors in your selections, please contact the appropriate required design professionals for this building.

R1_2.resultDisplayMessage: Based on your selections, this proposed building project does not meet the BC Building Code 2024 requirements for means of egress from a dwelling unit.

R1_3.resultDisplayMessage: Based on the building characteristics provided, this dwelling unit conforms with the requirements of BC Building Code 2024 for the egress of dwelling units in accordance with Subsection 9.9.9. If there are additional dwelling units within this building that have not been assessed to determine conformance with the egress requirements of Subsection 9.9.9 of the BC Building Code 2024 click "Start Over" below.
